repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/28968 / 8e5de40f90476249e9a2e5ef135143b5c6a0b512 which is part of implementing https://bugs.python.org/issue35134 moved the header "longintrepr.h" into a sub-folder.  The notes on this change suggested to include "Python.h" instead.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,14 +1,28 @@
 # mode: compile
 
-cdef extern from "Python.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"

@@ -1,14 +1,28 @@
 # mode: compile
 
-cdef extern from "Python.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"
+    #if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x03000000
+     #include "Python.h"
+    #else
+     #include "longintrepr.h"
+    #endif
+    """
     ctypedef struct PyTypeObject:
         pass
 
     ctypedef struct PyObject:
         Py_ssize_t ob_refcnt
         PyTypeObject *ob_type
 
-cdef extern from "longintrepr.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"

comment_data.body: Sorry - the extra `"` looks like it came from me
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,14 +1,28 @@
 # mode: compile
 
-cdef extern from "Python.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"

@@ -1,14 +1,28 @@
 # mode: compile
 
-cdef extern from "Python.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"
+    #if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x03000000
+     #include "Python.h"
+    #else
+     #include "longintrepr.h"
+    #endif
+    """

@@ -1,7 +1,14 @@
 # Internals of the "long" type (Python 2) or "int" type (Python 3).
 # This is not part of Python's published API.
 
-cdef extern from "longintrepr.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"
+    #if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x03000000
+     #include "Python.h"
+    #else
+     #include "longintrepr.h"
+    #endif
+    """

@@ -1,14 +1,28 @@
 # mode: compile
 
-cdef extern from "Python.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"
+    #if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x03000000
+     #include "Python.h"
+    #else
+     #include "longintrepr.h"
+    #endif
+    """
     ctypedef struct PyTypeObject:
         pass
 
     ctypedef struct PyObject:
         Py_ssize_t ob_refcnt
         PyTypeObject *ob_type
 
-cdef extern from "longintrepr.h":
+cdef extern from *:
+    """"
+    #if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x03000000
+     #include "Python.h"
+    #else

@@ -1,7 +1,12 @@
 # Internals of the "long" type (Python 2) or "int" type (Python 3).
 # This is not part of Python's published API.

commit.message:
FIX: change c includes to account for upstream changes

https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/28968 /
8e5de40f90476249e9a2e5ef135143b5c6a0b512 which is part of implementing
https://bugs.python.org/issue35134 moved the header "longintrepr.h" into a
sub-folder.  The notes on this change suggested to include "Python.h" instead.

verification.payload:

parent 1461e514c00056eef58c7c18262012b1510ba692
author Thomas A Caswell <tcaswell@gmail.com> 1635285871 -0400
committer Thomas A Caswell <tcaswell@gmail.com> 1635381727 -0400

FIX: change c includes to account for upstream changes

https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/28968 /
8e5de40f90476249e9a2e5ef135143b5c6a0b512 which is part of implementing
https://bugs.python.org/issue35134 moved the header "longintrepr.h" into a
sub-folder.  The notes on this change suggested to include "Python.h" instead.

commit.message: Simplify the header file selection. We always need Python.h, and only sometimes longintrepr.h.

Simplify the header file selection. We always need Python.h, and only sometimes longintrepr.h.
